items.q: Is AberoAI a chatbot or a system?
items.a:
AberoAI is <m>not a chatbot</m>.

It is a <m>Patient Communication Operating System</m> —
a system that governs how conversations are received, routed, remembered, and
acted upon across time, channels, and teams.

Chatbots are features.
AberoAI is the <m>infrastructure</m> that keeps communication stable, consistent, and
reliable at scale.

items.q: Can AberoAI support multilingual and international clinics?
items.a:
Yes — AberoAI is designed specifically for <m>cross-border clinics</m>.

It supports multilingual conversations, international patients, time-zone differences, and language-specific workflows —
while preserving conversation context and continuity across the entire patient journey.

Language is treated as <m>a structural layer</m>, not an add-on.

items.q: Does AberoAI replace our team or work alongside it?
items.a:
AberoAI does <m>not replace your team</m>.

It removes structural pressure so your team can operate calmly and consistently.

Routine conversations, follow-ups, and information flow are handled by the system,
while your staff remains in control of critical decisions, care, and human judgment.

Think of AberoAI as <m>operational support</m>, not a substitute.

items.q: How does AberoAI handle high message volume at scale?
items.a:
AberoAI is built for <m>high-volume, multi-tenant environments</m>.

Messages are processed through governed workflows, intelligent routing, and load-aware automation —
preventing overload, missed conversations, or fragmented context.

As volume increases, the system absorbs the pressure —
your operations remain predictable.

items.q: How do clinics typically begin using AberoAI?
items.a:
Most clinics begin with <m>one operational layer</m> —
such as WhatsApp response handling or patient follow-ups.

From there, AberoAI expands gradually into booking workflows, aftercare, and retention analytics —
without disrupting existing systems or staff.

Adoption is <m>progressive, controlled, and system-driven</m>.
